text: I’m curious what’s the best way to find a contact via the recommended `@HubSpot/api-client`

I’m looking into the recommended way to `search` for a contact according to this README.doc

<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-nodejs#example-search-contacts>

Hey all. I have a question. I am a trainee developer with no experience in API. I surfed around google and in HubSpot it is possible to import tasks (deals) with API. So I came to slack to look for some guidance and help as I am trying to import tasks to hubSpot
Hi <@U03828U9C2E>, thanks for your message :slightly_smiling_face: What do you mean by "is your API correct?"?
I think so, check this API <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/tasks>

Trying to post custom behavioral events from external application. Is the endpoint <https://api.hubapi.com/events/v3/send> not in scope for Private App authentication? I'm getting an error message. "The scope needed for this API call isn't available for public use" I would prefer not to use the account API key.
I believe API Key auth is the only thing accepted for that endpoint
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/events> for test calls in the endpoint docs there is no OAuth/bearer option

Hello everyone! I am making a custom Webportal and would like to continue utilizing the user accounts and profiles I already have stored on HubDB. I am wondering if I am able to access HubDB without using any HubL or HubSpot CMS, on a completely decoupled react app platform. Thank you!
